choices.answer: A special passport you need for accessing all the computers in Canada
The development of appropriate, responsible, and empowered technology use
A certification you receive when you graduate from high school.
An automatic title you receive with your first username and password
Buy Your Own Device
Build Your Own Device
Break-in Your Own Device
Bring Your Own Device

questions.question: Why do you need to create a secure password that includes upper and lowercase letters, as well as numbers and symbols?

choices.answer: It looks cool because it’s unique.
The computer programs and apps won’t accept “1-2-3-4.”
It protects your personal information, academic work, and online reputation
It challenges your friends' password cracking abilities.

questions.question: Why do you have to cite resources, online texts, and pictures you copy and use from the Internet?

choices.answer: You can be accused of plagiarism if you don’t cite your sources.
You will get zeroes on your assignments if you don’t cite your sources.
You can get into trouble with your school, and maybe the law, if you don't.
All of the above.

questions.question: Why do you need to be careful with what you say and post online, especially in social media like Facebook or Twitter?

choices.answer: What goes online stays online, and it can affect your future and career.
People can challenge everything you say—they have nothing else better to do
Every time you post online, malware or a virus could infect your computer.
It's time consuming and takes you away from what's important—your homework!
This is the route you take when you type an address into Google Maps.
Your online reputation as you interact in online environments.
The number of keystrokes you make when you type your username and password.
This doesn’t exist because we can’t “walk around” online.

questions.question: Why is there a prevalence of bullying—known as “cyber-bullying”—on the internet?

choices.answer: People don’t have time to bully others face-to-face anymore.
People can bully others around the world now by using the internet.
People can hide behind the screen instead of facing the others they bully.
People don’t know they're being bullies online, especially in social media.

questions.question: Hate speech online promotes hatred against people or groups. Where will you most likely encounter hate speech online?

choices.answer: Social media, like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Snapchat
Dot org sites
Wikipedia
Online news sites, such as Global News, The Toronto Star, or CNN

questions.question: What should you do if you encounter hate speech online, and you want to stop the hatred from spreading?

choices.answer: Yell at the offensive person and post in a reply by using shouty caps.
Ignore the post and wait for someone else to take action.
Take a screenshot of the offensive post and email it to the police.
Report the hate post to the platform it's on so the account can be banned.

questions.question: Why is it so important for you to learn about Digital Citizenship?

choices.answer: It's preparation for a society immersed in technology and global connection
You don’t want bad grades on your assignments.
You don’t want to be the next John Connor in Terminator 2: Judgement Day.
You intend to be the next Steve Jobs.
